greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (phi(-q) / phi(-q^2))^3 * phi(q^3)^5 / phi(-q^6) in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (12 t)) = 8 (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A133739.
mathematica: a[n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[(EllipticTheta[3, 0, -q]/EllipticTheta[3, 0, -q^2])^3*(EllipticTheta[3, 0, q^3]^5/EllipticTheta[3, 0, -q^6]), {q, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n,0,50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 22 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^6 * eta(x^4 + A)^3 * eta(x^6 + A)^23 / ( eta(x^2 + A)^9 * eta(x^3 + A)^10 * eta(x^12 + A)^9 ), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 06 2007
